1.title: Basement Blowout
1.plot: Newlyweds Jeff and Julie Simon want to blow out their 70s throwback basement on the cheap. But local building and fire codes threaten to squash the budget before the building begins. When the happy couple needs help freeing up cash, they turn to the Money Hunters: Matt Blashaw and Deanne Bell.

4.title: Two Room Transformation
4.plot: David and Michele Rogers' home renovation is down to just two rooms, a drab den and a shady sun-porch. Michele isn't afraid to spend, but David has a firm price in mind for the project. When her plan for the porch goes awry, it's up to the Money Hunters to work out a compromise, without compromising the project.

6.title: A Knock-Out Kitchen
6.plot: Thuy Thammavong had the kitchen of her dreams, but left it behind when she and husband Steve moved into a bigger house for their growing family. Steve will spare no expense to make his wife a satisfied chef again, but Thuy needs the Money Hunters' help to keep Steve from spending them into the poor house.

7.plot:

8.title: Inside-Out Renovation
8.plot: Paul Tilghman and Melanie Rodriguez are new parents with an old house. They each have their own passion project that they want to tackle: Paul's wants a rehabbed yard with patio and Melanie's wants a functional utility room. The compromise is one that only the Money Hunters could pull off... do 'em both

9.title: The Footballer and the Basement
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: A Stick in the Mudroom
10.plot: LaMonte Adams' mud room "serves its purpose," but wife Zarah wants to warm up their chilly utility. The open ceiling, bare floor, and exposed HVAC are eyesores! Guests enter through the garage and the mud room makes a lousy first impression. LaMonte is willing to make improvements, but only for $5,000. Zarah is going to need some Money Hunter help to spend wisely.

11.title: This Old Townhouse
11.plot: John McGovern bought this 1860's house 5 years ago. Two years later he met Marisa, who has been patient with living in a constant construction zone. Will John be able to trust Money Hunters to get this project done?

12.title: Baths in the Belfry
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: Pool of Uncertainty
13.plot: When it comes to their new backyard, the Jones are at a total loss. They have a weather-beaten wood deck, a sagging fence and no idea where to begin. They desperately need Matt and Deanne's help.

1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Pharmacists, Quinn and Lauren Czosnowski, know their kitchen is down and out. The symptoms? Outdated cabinets, peeling floor tiles and a functional at best countertop. Unfortunately, their budget is more over-the-counter than prescription strength. They want a kitchen like the ones they see in magazines but have a fraction of a high end budget. Lucky for them the Money Hunters are here to increase their DIY dosage and give them the kitchen they long for.

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Ryan and Lauren Lawrence's basement needs a head-to-toe gut job, but improvements to the rest of their home have sapped their savings. Ryan's an electrician and can barter plumbing from a buddy, but in order to beat this budget, they'll need the Money Hunters to bat cleanup. Licensed contractor Matt Blashaw will bang out the carpentry while engineer Deanne Bell cuts costs.

3.title: Shoddy Potty
3.plot: Laura Mikowychok and Eric Smith are a newly engaged couple settling into their first home together and saving for their wedding. It's not all lovey-dovey though: the previous homeowner left them a funky beat-up bathroom , and a looming wedding is leaving them little cash. Watch as the Money Hunters flip this bath ... for under six grand!

4.title: Deck Dreamin
4.plot: Jeff & Lori Zeaman have been living with their tiny deck in their big backyard for almost decade. They dream of a deck four times the size with some extravagant amenities like composite decking, natural stone pavers and an outdoor plasma TV - but their 12K budget can't deliver all that. It's compromise time for these homeowners! We've got to rein these dreamers in and give them a tricked out deck & patio, Money Hunter style.

5.title: The Cramped Kitchen
5.plot: Expecting parents, Terence and Maria Thomas, need more space in their kitchen before the arrival of their first child, but there are two major obstacles. First, their basement staircase is gobbling up precious square footage in an already cramped kitchen. Second, they need to do a major structural renovation on a simple spruce-up budget. But Money Hunters, Matt and Deanne, do this kind of thing in their sleep. So, they're going to deliver on the Thomas's kitchen wish list AND make some major improvements to the adjoining dining room--all without breaking a sweat or ...

8.title: The $75,000 Master Suite
8.plot: Television host , Elizabeth Jennings ,and her businessman husband , Alex, are certainly not short on personality. What they are short on is space in their master suite. The solution? A huge , $75,000 renovation/addition! The problem? They only have two-thirds of that to spend. Will the Money Hunters be able to manage this massive budget or will they dig a foundation hole they can't afford to fill? Only one way to find out.

9.title: When It Rains It Pours... Into the Basement
9.plot: When we last saw Alex and Elizabeth Jennings they were enjoying their new 'Money Hunter' style $75,000 addition. But record rainfall, resulting in a flooded basement , dampened their mood right quick. And things only got worse when they received the insurance settlement. Now this couple is faced with the challenge of rebuilding their basement for a fraction of its worth. Sounds like it's time to call the 'Money Hunters'... again.

13.title: Episode #2.13
13.plot: Empty-nesters, Bill and Susan Hopkins, had big plans for their suburban home when they moved in 30 years ago. But life (and putting two daughters through college) got in the way. Now, they want to get those plans back on track with what's left in the bank account. Can the Money Hunters help breathe some life into their kitchen before it starts collecting social security? Oh, and there's another challenge: this has to be a green renovation to please their ivy-league educated, sustainable engineer, daughter
